VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE
Email a Buyer for an Abandoned Cart

Keep your buyers engaged with your brand and motivated to complete their purchase. When a buyer adds products to their cart but doesn't complete checkout, you can automatically email the buyer and entice them to return. By combining email templates, email alerts, and Process Builder, you can easily develop an automated message that references data directly from the buyer's cart.

REQUIRED EDITIONS AND USER PERMISSIONS

Salesforce Compatibility

Salesforce Classic (not available in all orgs) and Lightning Experience for Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.




B2B Commerce Compatibility

B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’20 (version 4.12)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (version 4.11)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’19 (version 4.10)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’18 (version 4.9)


USER PERMISSIONS NEEDED
To create or change email templates in Salesforce Classic:	Edit HTML Templates
To create, edit, or view processes:	

Manage Flow

AND

View All Data

NOTE You can send an abandoned cart email only to a registered user. This use case doesn't support a cart created by a guest.
Create an email template using Classic Email Templates.
NOTE This process doesn't support Lightning Experience email templates.
From Setup, enter Email Templates in the Quick Find box, and then select Classic Email Templates.
Click New Template.
Select Text or HTML.
For Available Merge Fields, select CC Cart Fields.
Enable Available For Use.
For Email Template Name, enter an internal-facing name for the template, such as Abandoned Cart Email.
For Subject, enter the text string that you want to appear for the email's subject line.
TIP Consider referencing fields on the corresponding cart record, such as the cart name or the owner name, to personalize the experience. From the merge field options, make sure that CC Cart Fields is selected (1). Then, select a field (2), such as Owner Full Name, and copy and paste the generated Salesforce Merge Language (SML) format for the field (3), such as {!ccrz__E_Cart__c.ccrz__BuyerFirstName__c}.
For Email Body, enter the body text for the mail, such as:
Hello,

Cart {!ccrz__E_Cart__c.ccrz__Name__c} was abandoned on {!ccrz__E_Cart__c.ccrz__LastActivityDate__c}.

{!ccrz__E_Cart__c.ccrz__CartId__c}
Click Save.
Create an email alert that sends the abandoned cart email to the cart's owner.
From Setup, enter Email Alerts in the Quick Find box, and then select Email Alerts.
Click New Email Alert.
Enter a Description, such as Abandoned Cart Alert, and a Unique Name, such as Abandoned_Cart_Alert.
For Object, select CC Cart.
From Email Template, select the template you created.
For Recipient Type, select Related User from the Search picklist, and then add Related User: User to the list of selected recipients.
NOTE Selecting this value ensures that the email is sent to the user that the cart record's User field references.
Select an appropriate From Email Address.
Click Save.
In Process Builder, set up an automated process that specifies the trigger conditions for sending the email.
From Setup, enter Process Builder in the Quick Find box, and then select Process Builder.
Click New.
Enter a Process Name, API Name, and optional Description, and specify that the process starts when a record changes.
Click Save.
Specify the object settings for the process.
On the process canvas, click Add Object (1).
For Object, select CC Cart (2).
For starting the process, enable when a record is created or edited (3).
Expand the Advanced section, and select Yes for recursion (4).
Click Save.
Specify the criteria for determining whether a cart is abandoned. For example, you can check the status of the cart, check the value of its Active Cart field, and evaluate whether the cart contains any items.
On the process canvas, click Add Criteria.
For Criteria Name, enter a name for this evaluation, such as Is Cart Abandoned?.
For Criteria for Executing Actions, select Conditions are met.
Set the following conditions:
FIELD	OPERATOR	TYPE	VALUE
Cart Status	Equals	Picklist	Open
Active Cart	Equals	Boolean	True
Total Quantity	Greater than or equal	Number	1
For Conditions, select All of the conditions are met (AND).
Expand the Advanced section, and select Yes for executing actions only when the specified changes are made to the record.
Click Save.
Specify the action that executes when the criteria conditions are true.
On the TRUE branch for the abandoned criteria, click Set Schedule under Scheduled Actions (2).
Specify the schedule for the action to execute. For example, maybe you want to send the email one day from now (2).
Click Save.
Finally, assign the email alert you created as the action to execute.
On the scheduled action, click Add Action (1).
For Action Type, select Email Alerts (2).
For Action Name, enter a name for this action, such as Send Abandoned Cart Email (3).
For Email Alert, enter the unique name you specified in step 2.c for the email alert you created, such as Abandoned_Cart_Alert.
Click Save.
Activate the process.
